Defining New Entities

Review: Entities in the data model (1 of 2)

Gi

¢ Anentity is a business object used by the application, such as Policy, User,

ABContact, Producer, etc.

¢ Entities are defined in ETI files

Review: Entities in the data model (2 of 2) a

5)

* Two main types:

eti + Base application entities

+ Custom entities

« Acustom entity is an entity
created by the customer

eti
* Acustom entity can be

created only on the
application level and it will be
local inside that application

Invoice

¢ Often, an entity stores data in a database table named for the entity:
* BankAccount_Ext entity in abx_bankaccount_ext table
+ ABContact entity in ab_abcontact table

¢ Exceptions are...

* Entities that share the columns in an entity table such as a subtype entity

« Virtual, non-persistent entities do not save data to the database. Guidewire recommends that
you do not create non-persistent entities as a general rule

Entities in the object model G

* Code generators generate Java classes from entities

« Entities can also have enhancements associated with them with additional functions and
properties

Foreign key

¢ Pointer to single instance of some other entity

« Example: each Contact can have one assigned user

ABContact

| Aray Gi
* Collection of pointers to instances of some other entity that is maintained by code
during runtime
« Requires reverse foreign key
¢ If entity A has array of entity B, then entity B must have foreign key pointing to entity A
« Example: each ABContact can have zero to many contact notes

ABContact Contact Note

TaxID

EmailAddress1

One-to-one relationships Gi

<onetoone> element defines a single-valued association to another entity that has
a one-to-one cardinality

Provides a reverse pointer to an entity that is pointing at the <onetoone> entity
through a foreign key

Often splits logical entity across multiple physical entities

Example: ABContact defines Financial Summary as one-to-one and
FinancialSummary defines a foreign key to ABContact

ABContact

FinancialSummary

TaxiD

. NumberOfClaims
EmailAddress1. FinancialSummat MostRecentClaim
FinancialSummary ABConta ABContact

Many-to-many relationships (1 of 2) a

¢ Requires an entity of type versionable that represents the many-to-many
relationship with the following:

* Two or more non-nullable foreign keys
« Unique index for all foreign keys

UserRole

Many-to-many relationships (2 of 2) a

To access the many-to-many relationship, add an array to one or both entities in
the relationship

* Roles array in User specifies that there is zero or more UserRoles for a given user

« Users array in Role specifies that there is zero or more UserRoles for a given role

UserRole

Circular relationships

* <edgeForeignKey> creates an edge table
« Links one entity to another or to self

« Ensures the safe ordering of data insertion and deletion in cases where cyclic references
prevent safe ordering

¢ Examples:

ABContact

* Child references parent
« Reference between subtypes

ABPerson

ABCompany

ABCompanyVendor

ntGroup

Demonstration G
Policy Summaries

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,— — What is the difference between an ETX file and an ETI file?

¢
¢
4

MS SS Se

Answer

,— — What is the difference between an ETX file and an ETI file?
4

¢
4

An ETX file extends a base application entity e.g. adding new columns. An ETI file
defines a new custom entity from scratch.

SS Se

Question

_— — Does the base application have ETI files? Can developers create new ETI
Fa files? Where and how?

MS SS Se

Gi

Answer
_— — Does the base application have ETI files? Can developers create new ETI
oo files? Where and how?

Yes, ETI files are in the base application. Developers can create new ETI files in the
...\extensions\entity\ folder using Guidewire Studio and the Entity Editor.

SS Se

Gi

Question

_— — 'f the ABLawyer entity has an array of Cases, what type of field is
: required on the Case entity?

¢
4

MS SS Se

Answer

_— — 'f the ABLawyer entity has an array of Cases, what type of field is
: required on the Case entity?

The Case entity requires a foreign key field in the ETI definition that specifies the
fkentity attribute as the ABLawyer entity.

¢
4

Question

,- — lodeploy data model changes, are you required to

¢
A) Regenerate the Data Dictionary?

B) Restart the application server?
C) Restart Studio?

MS SS Se

Answer Gi

a To deploy data model changes, are you required to:
x A) No, you are not required to regenerate the data dictionary. Regenerating the data
dictionary will identify any errors in the data model. If successful, the process will

add new and modified entities to the data dictionary.

B) Yes, you must restart the application server to deploy the new and modified
entities. The process creates new database tables and/or upgrades the database.

C) No, Studio is immediately aware of the data model changes. It is not necessary to
restart Guidewire Studio.

SS Se

review ; create a custom entity

Create entity elements and sub-elements that
define fields, foreign keys, and arrays on
entities

¢ Identify entity related data elements
associated with data model design

Creating new entities
